6. Hello, My name is Takeshi, I am Japanese and graduated from university this spring.
I will be going to the U.S. next month to study abroad for a long term to get my Ph.D. in pharmacy.
I have been working part-time along with my studies for the past 6 years since I entered university, and most of the money I earned, along with my student loan, was deposited into Saber.
This was in order to further save money for living expenses through stable yield and to focus on my research in the US.
In hindsight, this was a foolish act. You know the result.
Before the hack, I had $12,6000, but now I have only about $23,000, including some crypto that was not deposited in Saber.
Next month I will start paying off tuition, rent and living expenses in the US as well as my previous student loan, so with the remaining money I can only live in the US for a few months and my dream of getting a Ph.D. and inventing future medicines for people will be over.
Could you please return my money?
I hope for your generous action.
Thank you for reading my long, poorly written English.

source:
Hello, My name is Takeshi, I am Japanese and graduated from university this spring.
I will be going to the U.S. next month to study abroad for a long term to get my Ph.D. in pharmacy.
I have been working part-time along with my studies for the past 6 years since I entered university, and most of the money I earned, along with my student loan, was deposited into Saber.
This was in order to further save money for living expenses through stable yield and to focus on my research in the US.
In hindsight, this was a foolish act. You know the result.
Before the hack, I had $12,6000, but now I have only about $23,000, including some crypto that was not deposited in Saber.
Next month I will start paying off tuition, rent and living expenses in the US as well as my previous student loan, so with the remaining money I can only live in the US for a few months and my dream of getting a Ph.D. and inventing future medicines for people will be over.
Could you please return my money?
I hope for your generous action.
Thank you for reading my long, poorly written English.
